title: Tax Manager - LATAM
content:
Wise is one of Europe‚Äôs fastest growing companies, providing transparent and low cost money transfer services to over 10 million customers in more than 70 countries.  We are looking for an awesome new member of the Tax Team to come on board in Brazil, to help grow the market in a compliant way!
You‚Äôll be part of a commercially-minded Tax team, helping to ensure our tax affairs are efficient, transparently compliant and slick so that our mission is sustainable.
Key responsibilities:
Compliance 
As our Brazilian tax SME, you will be responsible for all tax returns (direct and indirect), payments, etc. and communicate with the wider finance teams about how those taxes should appear in our financial statements. We expect you to have good knowledge of the cadence of tax returns and what adjustments are required on them. Specifics like the deductibility or not of expenses from certain taxes (PIS, COFINS, ISS, IRPJ, CSLL) is also required, as well as providing support for other taxes like IOF-C√¢mbio. This should not take up a significant part of your day. 
Product Support & Advisor to the Business
Wise is successful because our Products are second to none. While Finance is a support team, we are considered key members of each product launch to ensure everything we launch is both commercially sound and compliant. We will require you to work closely with advisors, pulling from your own knowledge, to arrive at the best decision for the company. We also expect you to stay close to the guidance you provide the company and regularly run control processes to ensure your guidance has been applied properly. In the case of a law change, or a modification of a product that changes a previous tax position, we would expect you to partner with the relevant teams and work toward a solution. 
Specifically, you will be required to:

Lead on tax considerations for Brazil product expansion, working with the local Finance Director, Compliance Officers, Banking and Expansion team and external advisors.
Oversee the outsourced preparation of all tax computations for our three brazilian entities (IRPJ, CSLL, PIS/COFINS, ISS). 
Prepare IFRS and local GAAP tax provisions.
Lead on Brazil tax projects and provide regional input on global projects. 
Manage local tax audits and be the Brazilian tax authority relationship owner.
Support the Group‚Äôs indirect tax team on Brazil indirect tax advisory work. 
Keep up to date on the latest Brazilian tax policy developments and provide insightful updates to the business and tax team. 
Work closely with advisors, product managers, engineers, data analysts, product designers and other system teams to ease the efficiency of tax in our products
Involvement in LATAM regional projects and new market opportunities. 

 
Ideal candidate profile üòª:

Someone who is proactive and is able to make decisions independently, however, with a clear understanding of risk when decisions need to be escalated or external advice taken.
Able to build strong collaborative working relationships across the business, including in product, banking, engineering and across finance (including tax).
Someone with prior experience in regulated fintech / financial services (strongly preferred)
Able to appropriately measure, manage and communicate tax risks
Able to enjoy work and bring a smile to the office (at least twice a week!). 
Comfortable with working across multiple timezones.

 
What we‚Äôre not looking for ‚õî: 

Someone with poor communication skills, overcomplicating message or not getting to the point.
Someone who is not intellectually curious and doesn‚Äôt ask questions.  
Someone who would not be a good team/culture fit - arrogance, no can do attitude etc. 
Someone who likes routine and is not able to deal with an ever changing work load and business. 
Someone who is not forthcoming with mistakes or someone who is not diligent about fixing them.

 
What we‚Äôre offering:

üöÄ  RSU‚Äôs in a rapidly growing company after a year with us
üíª Hybrid working model ‚Äì A combination of work-from-home and from the office 
‚úàÔ∏è  Wisers can work remotely for 90 days a year. By ‚Äòremote‚Äô we don‚Äôt just mean from home, but from wherever in the world you choose to
üí™  An annual self-development budget
ü©∫  Health and dental allowance for you and your dependents
üíù  Company-paid: Life Insurance, and an EAP program
‚òÄÔ∏è  Paid time off: 30 days vacation + 3 ‚ÄúMe‚Äù days + 1 volunteer day, annually
üèùÔ∏è  A paid 6-week sabbatical leave after four years
üë∂üèº  18-weeks of paid parental leave, after a year with us and child care assistance
üöå Transportation vouchers
üçï Meal (560 BRL per month) and food (880 BRL per month) vouchers
üèãÔ∏è (BRL): TotalPass access to 3,500 gyms and studios throughout Brazil

#LI-KE1We're people without borders ‚Äî without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.
